name: Tragedy
description: Christopher Booker's archetypal plot where the hero's flaws lead to their downfall
distribution_philosophy: Based on Booker's tragedy structure with emphasis on the fatal flaw and inevitable downfall
examples: Romeo and Juliet, Macbeth, Breaking Bad

anticipation_stage.name: Anticipation Stage
anticipation_stage.description: The hero is introduced with a fatal flaw that will lead to their doom

dream_stage.name: Dream Stage
dream_stage.description: The hero seems to be succeeding, but the flaw grows stronger

frustration_stage.name: Frustration Stage
frustration_stage.description: Things begin to go wrong as the hero's flaw creates problems

nightmare_stage.name: Nightmare Stage
nightmare_stage.description: The hero's world collapses as their flaw leads to catastrophe

destruction.name: Destruction or Death
destruction.description: The hero faces the ultimate consequence of their fatal flaw
